üö®ATTENTION Goose Creek CISD FAMILIESüö®

We are working to help answer common questions regarding technology for the start of virtual instruction.

‚≠êQUESTION #1‚≠ê
Is my student required to get an iPad from GCCISD?

‚≠êANSWER‚≠ê
A GCCISD iPad is recommended but not required. If you have a personal iPad or computer/laptop, these can be used during virtual learning and for the first day of school. A GCCISD iPad is not required to start virtual instruction on Tuesday.

There are advantages to using a GCCISD iPad, it will automatically connect to district WiFi when near a building or when returning to campus for face-to-face instruction. Additionally, there may be iPad apps the district has purchased (at no cost to families) that are only available when using a district device.

Devices that are NOT recommended for virtual instruction include cell phones and Android tablets. Some of our programs will not work properly on these devices.

üîóADDITIONAL RESOURCESüîó
Please check out the Students/Families section of our website http://www.gccisd.net/edtech

GCCISD Families,

At the July 6th board meeting, the Goose Creek CISD Board of Trustees discussed the option of all students receiving virtual instruction at the start of the school as well as implementing a hybrid model. The hybrid model, which includes face to face instruction, will provide modified instructional days. The model will also limit class sizes to no more than 15 students. Since the safety of our students and staff is our priority, campuses will provide social distancing, ensure campuses are cleaned frequently and enforce the use of masks. The proposed hybrid model for the grade levels will be posted on the district webpage for you to review.

If you prefer for your child/children to receive instruction virtually at home, you will need to register by logging in to the Parent Portal. More details on the proposed hybrid plan and how to register your students for 100% Virtual At-Home Learning can be found at https://www.gccisd.net/page/article/5371

We appreciate your patience as we work to provide a safe return to school.
